snippet: Daniel Chong, a University of California student, was swept up in a Drug Enforcement Administration raid and placed in a holding cell, where he said he was forgotten for four days, without food or water.
abstract: Drug Enforcement Agency is conducting an internal investigation concerning the case of Daniel Chong, University of California student who was placed in a holding cell and forgotten for four days without food or water, following a raid by the agency. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES -- By his own admission, Daniel Chong planned to spend April 20 like so many other college students: smoking marijuana with friends to celebrate an unofficial holiday devoted to the drug. But for Mr. Chong, the celebration ended in a Kafkaesque nightmare inside a San Diego Drug Enforcement Administration holding cell, where he said he was forgotten for four days, without food or water.

headline.main: California Man's 'Drug Holiday' Becomes Four-Day Nightmare in Holding Cell
